question: who developed the central processing unit (cpu)
vanilla_rag_result: The development of the central processing unit (CPU) cannot be attributed to a single individual, as it was a collaborative effort involving multiple engineers and researchers over time. However, the concept of a single-chip microprocessor CPU was significantly advanced by Sharp engineer Tadashi Sasaki, who, in a 1968 meeting, discussed the idea with an unnamed female software engineering researcher. This collaboration led to the design of the Intel 4004, which is recognized as the first microprocessor. Additionally, the term "central processing unit" has been used in the computer industry since at least the early 1960s, indicating that the development of CPUs involved contributions from various individuals and companies throughout the years.
